Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.

Alassane Ouattara, reelected president of Côte d'Ivoire, is France's last major ally in Africa
subhead: The president, who was reelected for a fourth term on October 27, has been close to French presidents since Nicolas Sarkozy, to whom he owes his rise to power in 2011. France is still the top investor in Côte d'Ivoire.

title: Morocco seeks prosecution of over 2,400 protesters after Gen Z demonstrations
subhead: More than 2,400 people, including minors, are facing prosecution over recent 'Gen Z' protests demanding better education, healthcare and an end to corruption. Dozens have been sentenced to up to 15 years in prison.

title: Australia creates a strategic mineral reserve to counter Chinese dominance
subhead: With this project, as well as through its partnership with the US, Australia, a major producer of critical metals, is seeking to develop its sovereign mineral processing capacity.

title: A year after deadly floods, Valencia's residents still angry at authorities' failures
subhead: The unprecedented torrential rains that struck the Valencia region on October 29, 2024 have left deep scars among the local population.

title: 'You can see poverty spreading': France's welfare services confront growing hardship
subhead: Around France, agents of the CAF, a government body that provides welfare benefits, deal with difficult situations as social precarity increases.

title: French lawmakers debate 'confiscatory' taxation in budget talks
subhead: On Monday, French MPs voted in favor of a government amendment to increase a tax on large corporations by €2 billion. But how far can taxes be raised before they reach intolerable levels?
